2.text: Heat the pan over medium to medium-high heat for one minute.

4.text: Add your food, making sure your pan is big enough to hold all of it easily.

5.text: Stir regularly or shake the pan so the food doesn't stick.

6.text: Test if the food is done.

9.text: Know the difference between sautéing and other frying methods.

10.text: Resist the urge to press down on your meats and veggies.

11.text: Choose a big-enough pan when sautéing.

13.text: Get a good digital thermometer to read the doneness of meats.
